job_title: RN New Grad Residency in Tustin, CA
pros: Great place to learn when fresh out of nursing school.
cons: So far I have been enjoying my time working here.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tustin, CA
pros: Pay is generous. Weekend differential, night shift differential and time and a half pay after working 8 hours.
cons: Patient population can be difficult to deal with.

pros:
Decent workloads not hard at all
Chill coworkers
cons:
Upper management is non existent. 
Growth and opportunities for advancement non existent. 
High turnover rate due lack of resources, don’t value good employees, and accountability.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Norwalk, CA
pros: friendly coworkers and friendly environment to work in
cons: not able to use my experience fully

review_title: The coworkers make it worth staying
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tustin, CA
pros: New grad program with decent support, positive and supportive colleagues, hard to get fired
cons: Lack of material resources, lack of support from management, little to no accountability for mistakes, management did not listen to staff during Covid pandemic, management pushed RNs into unsafe ratios and covid pts into crowded hospital rooms

pros: Coworkers made the job so fun and for the most part are so supportive.
cons: Management does not listen to employees and have poor appreciation of staff. Communication between management and the rest of the staff is horrible. Low wages!

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Tustin, CA
pros: 8 hours PTO accrual every paycheck (bi-weekly).  A select few excellent nurses,  CNA's and upper-management . Pay is decent. Hospital is small so you get to know most everyone there. Most RN's are willing to offer help if needed. Holiday schedue rotates anually and is rather fair.
cons: Benefit packages are mediocre and expensive if coverage for more than just the employee is needed.  Their 401K is NOT matched., AT ALL Organization is somewhat disorganized. There are some CNA's that as an RN you cannot deped on and dread sharing patients with. Some CNA's even hide to avoid work and ignore calls requesting thier assitance on the walkie. A lot of registry RNs and registry CNA's because they find better opportunites or just simply burnout. Doctors have RN's enter their orders, even if they are sitting in front of a computer.  Patient population is horrid, lots of psych, homeless, and drug seeking frequent flyer patients. Annual pay increase is a joke, less than $1, if even that. Management can be clicky with favorites. Cafeteria closed on weekeneds and closes at 1:30 on weekdays. Often short staffed and sitters not avaiable for patient's that need them. Often times RN's end up with "primary" patients in which the RN is resonsible for RN and CNA duties. Out of the two nursing stations only one of them has a monitor tech who also answers phone calls and patient call-lights. At the other nursing station the RN's are left having to answer the patient call-light calls and the phone.

review_title: Unhealthy and Nasty Place to Work
pros: Some staff are good. But most are not.
cons: Bad management, staff don't know what they doing. The best staff always end up leaving. They put people as management who don't care and don't know what they doing. Medsurg  dont care about patient needs. Lights keep blinking and patients get mad. Pediatric is always dirty. Big infection control issue. Always HIPAA violation. Hospital just passed JCAHO. Who knows how. Very difficult to work with rt team. Most of them don't know what they doing and how to handle emergency situations. Come to work in this hospital if you want to give yourself a heart attack. Always short staff.

review_title: potential for this to be a nice community gem
pros: great co-workers and hospital is nicely situated near homes and businesses.
cons: communication can be better and better resources for basic work needs

pros: Very spacious work place.  Warm coworkers.

review_title: Foothill is a decent first step into nursing
pros: Coworkers, atmosphere, friendliness, willingness to help
cons: Few resources, MDs hard to get ahold of, delays in care, poor communication
